revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-05 05:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Don't use ignoreskipactivation for thin LVM"

Commit 8f5e10d7ed8eead221cccb6a0ccf1afea310b0a9 wrongly assumed that
the "ignoreskipactivation" flag is not needed when using thin LVM
provisioning. This is wrong.
Using thin LVM leads now to an error when the content will be copied:

ERROR cinder.volume.manager Command: sudo cinder-rootwrap /etc/cinder/
      rootwrap.conf dd if=/dev/mapper/cinder--volumes-_snapshot--UUID
      of=/dev/mapper/cinder--volumes-volume--UUID
      count=1073741824 bs=1M iflag=count_bytes conv=sparse

The reason is that the the snapshot is not activated and due to that,
no device node is available under /dev/mapper .

This reverts commit 8f5e10d7ed8eead221cccb6a0ccf1afea310b0a9 and makes
thin provisioning for LVM working again.

Change-Id: I788b297af92e11063b18c05a415b6f4d4d4bcd2c
Closes-Bug: #1702322
Related-Bug: #1701545
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Don't use ignoreskipactivation for thin LVM"

Commit 8f5e10d7ed8eead221cccb6a0ccf1afea310b0a9 wrongly assumed that
the "ignoreskipactivation" flag is not needed when using thin LVM
provisioning. This is wrong.
Using thin LVM leads now to an error when the content will be copied:

ERROR cinder.volume.manager Command: sudo cinder-rootwrap /etc/cinder/
      rootwrap.conf dd if=/dev/mapper/cinder--volumes-_snapshot--UUID
      of=/dev/mapper/cinder--volumes-volume--UUID
      count=1073741824 bs=1M iflag=count_bytes conv=sparse

The reason is that the the snapshot is not activated and due to that,
no device node is available under /dev/mapper .

This reverts commit 8f5e10d7ed8eead221cccb6a0ccf1afea310b0a9 and makes
thin provisioning for LVM working again.

Change-Id: I788b297af92e11063b18c05a415b6f4d4d4bcd2c
Closes-Bug: #1702322
Related-Bug: #1701545

with swift, lets use the correct name. In newer versions

be backported to newton: I40f47d46fdb06f31a739b590bf653bca71e33f61

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-04 01:59:40.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/enabled/_1070_project_ng_details_panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/ngdetails/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/ngdetails/__init__.py'], 'message': "Cleanup ngdetails

'ngdetails' had removed 'project' from its URL as following:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396800/
The change for URL is coded in 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/
core-constants.module.js'.

Furthermore ngdetails is not linked from any django panels and
doesn't have urls.py for '/project/ngdetails' originally.
On the otherside Angularized panel has routes for details view as SPA.
So 'ngdetails' doesn't need django panel for '/project/ngdetails/'.

This patch removes django panel for '/project/ngdetails/'

Change-Id: I1431c93eeabaa1778a35c0cbacd019b44822edc9
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup ngdetails

'ngdetails' had removed 'project' from its URL as following:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396800/
The change for URL is coded in 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/
core-constants.module.js'.

Furthermore ngdetails is not linked from any django panels and
doesn't have urls.py for '/project/ngdetails' originally.
On the otherside Angularized panel has routes for details view as SPA.
So 'ngdetails' doesn't need django panel for '/project/ngdetails/'.

This patch removes django panel for '/project/ngdetails/'

Change-Id: I1431c93eeabaa1778a35c0cbacd019b44822edc9

commit_message:
Add bluestore support for OSD's

Add highly experimental support for bluestore storage format for
OSD devices; this is disabled by default and should only be enabled
in deployments where loss of data does not present a problem!

Change-Id: I21beff9ce535f1b5c16d7f6f51c35126cc7da43e
Depends-On: I36f7aa9d7b96ec5c9eaa7a3a970593f9ca14cb34

commit_message:
Add bluestore support for OSD's

Add highly experimental support for bluestore storage format for
OSD devices; this is disabled by default and should only be enabled
in deployments where loss of data does not present a problem!

Change-Id: I67323e26a4698de4e08c8c755db232399f7fed02
Depends-On: I36f7aa9d7b96ec5c9eaa7a3a970593f9ca14cb34

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-07-02 07:23:08.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml'], 'message': 'Co-gate spec helper gem with puppet-openstackci

In order to properly test changes in the spec helper gem that may affect
the puppet modules that depend on it, make sure the gem is checked out
from zuul as part of the puppet-openstackci beaker job. This job is run
for all infra modules so it is a reasonable job to co-gate with the
helper gem.

Change-Id: I66279da5f3cadb8a693c18379a2bdcf08edb2f15

commit_message:
Co-gate spec helper gem with puppet-openstackci

In order to properly test changes in the spec helper gem that may affect
the puppet modules that depend on it, make sure the gem is checked out
from zuul as part of the puppet-openstackci beaker job. This job is run
for all infra modules so it is a reasonable job to co-gate with the
helper gem.

Change-Id: I66279da5f3cadb8a693c18379a2bdcf08edb2f15
Needed-by: I1b9ca7f38920a2c901ae16f6302af9b3a1ab36b6

commit_message:
Add featureset26 for scenario006

featureset26 will deploy a multinode job and instead of OpenStack on the
overcloud, we'll deploy COE (k8s) with scenario006. The job is
experimental for now.

commit_message:
Merge locale files for packaging

Currently compile_catalog is unable to automatically locate locale
files. This commit merges existing files into one single file
with the project name. This then matches the same behaviour with
other projects.

Change-Id: Ib7b566a852e46ed0505cfff632a6b8473a89d736

subject: Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 22:51:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': 'Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._delete_floatingip still uses
utils.is_extension_supported to determine if DNS-specific methods should
be run rather than the self._is_dns_integration_supported method used
by _create and _update.

This causes issues with L3 service plugins like Cisco ACI where the core
plugin is ML2 but the L3 plugin does not implement the DNS methods.
When such a plugin sets _dns_integration to False, _create and _update
do not call the DNS-specific plugin methods, but _delete_floatingip does
 which leads to an exception being raised.

This patch changes _delete_floatingip to use the same method for
determining DNS support as _create_floatingip and _update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ieb2db6cb96c5d6aae166aa7f0d2d481b2a3690f9
Closes-Bug: #1702693
(cherry picked from commit a6f83bc0aa7575b74c9267b2e399b9d830942e77)
'}]
commit_message:
Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._delete_floatingip still uses
utils.is_extension_supported to determine if DNS-specific methods should
be run rather than the self._is_dns_integration_supported method used
by _create and _update.

This causes issues with L3 service plugins like Cisco ACI where the core
plugin is ML2 but the L3 plugin does not implement the DNS methods.
When such a plugin sets _dns_integration to False, _create and _update
do not call the DNS-specific plugin methods, but _delete_floatingip does
 which leads to an exception being raised.

This patch changes _delete_floatingip to use the same method for
determining DNS support as _create_floatingip and _update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ieb2db6cb96c5d6aae166aa7f0d2d481b2a3690f9
Closes-Bug: #1702693
(cherry picked from commit a6f83bc0aa7575b74c9267b2e399b9d830942e77)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 22:50:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': 'Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._delete_floatingip still uses
utils.is_extension_supported to determine if DNS-specific methods should
be run rather than the self._is_dns_integration_supported method used
by _create and _update.

This causes issues with L3 service plugins like Cisco ACI where the core
plugin is ML2 but the L3 plugin does not implement the DNS methods.
When such a plugin sets _dns_integration to False, _create and _update
do not call the DNS-specific plugin methods, but _delete_floatingip does
 which leads to an exception being raised.

This patch changes _delete_floatingip to use the same method for
determining DNS support as _create_floatingip and _update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ieb2db6cb96c5d6aae166aa7f0d2d481b2a3690f9
Closes-Bug: #1702693
(cherry picked from commit a6f83bc0aa7575b74c9267b2e399b9d830942e77)

commit_message:
Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._delete_floatingip still uses
utils.is_extension_supported to determine if DNS-specific methods should
be run rather than the self._is_dns_integration_supported method used
by _create and _update.

This causes issues with L3 service plugins like Cisco ACI where the core
plugin is ML2 but the L3 plugin does not implement the DNS methods.
When such a plugin sets _dns_integration to False, _create and _update
do not call the DNS-specific plugin methods, but _delete_floatingip does
 which leads to an exception being raised.

This patch changes _delete_floatingip to use the same method for
determining DNS support as _create_floatingip and _update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ieb2db6cb96c5d6aae166aa7f0d2d481b2a3690f9
Closes-Bug: #1702693
(cherry picked from commit a6f83bc0aa7575b74c9267b2e399b9d830942e77)

subject: Rebuild charm to sync charmhelpers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-05 19:19:58.000000000', 'files': ['rebuild'], 'message': 'Rebuild charm to sync charmhelpers

Add a rebuild nonce to the charm-keystone-ldap charm the same
as other reactive charms. This allows the charm to trigger a
rebuild when upstream dependencies need to be synced into a
reactive charm.

This sync will pull in a change for parsing config flags that
will ensure the ordering is consistent each time the config
flag parsing is executed (even across hook invocations).

Change-Id: I4a4b58a2176314b69c577810a9e15d0814e24ae5
Closes-Bug: #1698343
'}]
commit_message:
Rebuild charm to sync charmhelpers

Add a rebuild nonce to the charm-keystone-ldap charm the same
as other reactive charms. This allows the charm to trigger a
rebuild when upstream dependencies need to be synced into a
reactive charm.

This sync will pull in a change for parsing config flags that
will ensure the ordering is consistent each time the config
flag parsing is executed (even across hook invocations).

Change-Id: I4a4b58a2176314b69c577810a9e15d0814e24ae5
Closes-Bug: #1698343

commit_message:
Fix openstackdocstheme settings

To use openstackdocstheme 1.11.0 properly, this patch fixes

commit_message:
Change the variable name play_hosts to ansible_play_hosts

Starting in Ansible 2.2, the play_hosts variable has been
renamed to ansible_play_hosts. play_hosts is now deprecated
and may be removed in a future release of Ansible.

Also, the play_hosts variable represents the hosts in a
serial batch, rather than all the hosts targeted by the
playbook which is what these variables are intending.

Reference: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_variables.html#magic-variables-and-how-to-access-information-about-other-hosts

Backport note:
Re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/473197
due to structural changes.

Closes-Bug: 1674947
Change-Id: I3540aee86c0fd3a2b0bf086d4770b765aa1a052e

commit_message:
Create python-jobs-trusty job group

Only a few projects need trusty jobs, let's split up python-jobs so that
we only define jobs for those projects that need it - and not for
everybody.

This is the first part in the series, it moves python34 jobs over and
adds it for those projects that need it.

Change-Id: Ib268711bec56276a039db287dc42e8a02593b805

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10061, 'name': 'Joe Talerico', 'email': 'jtaleric@redhat.com', 'username': 'rook'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20330, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Networking CI', 'email': 'microsoft_neutron_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_neutron_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-13 15:06:51.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/change-oslo-db-defaults-f94df09c30767f95.yaml', 'neutron/common/config.py', 'neutron/tests/base.py'], 'message': "Don't override default values for oslo.db options

This change will make neutron-server use default values from oslo.db if
any of them are not overridden in config files, instead of applying its
own unique values that may be unexpected to users and operators.

It also makes our config files correct since now we don't claim wrong
values being default. (Remember the config generator was never aware of
our snowflake behaviour.)

If you wonder why we were overriding it in the first place, it was
needed back in the times when we were using db module from
oslo-incubator that has not provided proper defaults. Those times are
long gone.

Of course the change is not impact free, and operators who for some
reason want to keep the old values may need to adjust their
configuration files. Still, I believe using default values from oslo.db
is the correct thing to do long term.

We still need to set connection string for unit tests to sqlite:// since
oslo.db doesn't provide any default value for the option. It should be
fine to effectively unset default value for the option for
neutron-server since no one in production can use sqlite anyway.

This change also drops set_db_defaults function from
neutron.common.config. I have checked that there are no consumers for
the function outside the tree.

NeutronLibImpact
UpgradeImpact

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia97d6cf24e554f7b3878dd301ae4e7e10a1c9998
Closes-Bug: #1682307
"}]
commit_message:
Don't override default values for oslo.db options

This change will make neutron-server use default values from oslo.db if
any of them are not overridden in config files, instead of applying its
own unique values that may be unexpected to users and operators.

It also makes our config files correct since now we don't claim wrong
values being default. (Remember the config generator was never aware of
our snowflake behaviour.)

If you wonder why we were overriding it in the first place, it was
needed back in the times when we were using db module from
oslo-incubator that has not provided proper defaults. Those times are
long gone.

Of course the change is not impact free, and operators who for some
reason want to keep the old values may need to adjust their
configuration files. Still, I believe using default values from oslo.db
is the correct thing to do long term.

We still need to set connection string for unit tests to sqlite:// since
oslo.db doesn't provide any default value for the option. It should be
fine to effectively unset default value for the option for
neutron-server since no one in production can use sqlite anyway.

This change also drops set_db_defaults function from
neutron.common.config. I have checked that there are no consumers for
the function outside the tree.

NeutronLibImpact
UpgradeImpact

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia97d6cf24e554f7b3878dd301ae4e7e10a1c9998
Closes-Bug: #1682307

Change-Id: I56e4c3d06d5a8d8c59d8c5218afda7811aa2954e
'}]
commit_message:
test-vars.yml: Always disable private devices

This is only useful when using dynamic inventory which is not something
that tests so or when explicitely asked by the deployer. None of the OSA
tests define a 'properties' dictionary so this also causes breakages
like the following one:

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "AnsibleUndefinedVariable: {{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }} : 'properties' is undefined"}

Change-Id: I56e4c3d06d5a8d8c59d8c5218afda7811aa2954e

commit_message:
Switch from run_once back to inventory scoping

As it turns out, run_once executes a task
once per batch when executed from a serialised
playbook instead of once per set of play hosts
as previously thought.

In this patch we implement a combination of
dynamic inclusion, inventory scoping and
play host scoping to achieve the required
goal of only running it once, even when the
playbook is executed using limits.

Backport note:
Includes https://review.openstack.org/480999

Depends-On: I548971e2de92280fe2cc4ff0a6a926497733fa7d
Change-Id: Icde03cd2610f52859fd8d2d7540f442a36e51695

playbook is executed using limits.

Backport note:
ansible_play_hosts in Ansible 2.1 provides
the hosts for the play serial batch and not
the hosts for the play as a whole. It is
therefore not suitable, so we leave the
task scoping as it was.

Depends-On: I548971e2de92280fe2cc4ff0a6a926497733fa7d
Change-Id: Icde03cd2610f52859fd8d2d7540f442a36e51695
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from run_once back to inventory scoping

As it turns out, run_once executes a task
once per batch when executed from a serialised
playbook instead of once per set of play hosts
as previously thought.

In this patch we implement a combination of
dynamic inclusion, inventory scoping and
play host scoping to achieve the required
goal of only running it once, even when the
playbook is executed using limits.

Backport note:
ansible_play_hosts in Ansible 2.1 provides
the hosts for the play serial batch and not
the hosts for the play as a whole. It is
therefore not suitable, so we leave the
task scoping as it was.

Depends-On: I548971e2de92280fe2cc4ff0a6a926497733fa7d
Change-Id: Icde03cd2610f52859fd8d2d7540f442a36e51695

subject: Use openstackdocstheme in release note
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-06 18:13:55.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Use openstackdocstheme in release note

In the release notes build, openstackdocstheme is specified
in the sphinx extension list, but it is actually not used.
This commit configures openstackdocstheme as suggested in
the openstackdocstheme document.

Also specifies display_toc False in html_theme_options.
This prevents openstackdocstheme to add the local TOC automatically.
OSC has several releases during a single development cycle and
it leads to a long TOC at the top of individual pages.
It loses the readability and we can see version numbers in the
left sidebar, so we can safely disable the local TOC in
the release notes.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/openstackdocstheme/latest/

Change-Id: Iae08d309f7589bb13a1766f6fded70673ba24047
'}]
commit_message:
Use openstackdocstheme in release note

In the release notes build, openstackdocstheme is specified
in the sphinx extension list, but it is actually not used.
This commit configures openstackdocstheme as suggested in
the openstackdocstheme document.

Also specifies display_toc False in html_theme_options.
This prevents openstackdocstheme to add the local TOC automatically.
OSC has several releases during a single development cycle and
it leads to a long TOC at the top of individual pages.
It loses the readability and we can see version numbers in the
left sidebar, so we can safely disable the local TOC in
the release notes.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/openstackdocstheme/latest/

Change-Id: Iae08d309f7589bb13a1766f6fded70673ba24047

subject: Cast the resulting intersect set into a list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-07 11:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Cast the resulting intersect set into a list

When using Ansible with python3, the result of
the intersect filter is a set, not a list. This
causes a failure when trying to access item 0
in the list.

In this patch we cast the set to a list before
accessing item 0. This will work for both
python2 and python3.

Change-Id: I9b03c57a5b1f675a8ca6e42dd5aae6c1e4742603
'}]
commit_message:
Cast the resulting intersect set into a list

When using Ansible with python3, the result of
the intersect filter is a set, not a list. This
causes a failure when trying to access item 0
in the list.

In this patch we cast the set to a list before
accessing item 0. This will work for both
python2 and python3.

Change-Id: I9b03c57a5b1f675a8ca6e42dd5aae6c1e4742603

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-07 10:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Add '*.pyc' clean up for unit_tests

After updating code from actual branch we still use old *.pyc files.
It can give an unexpected result, for instance, a lot of tests are
broken due to unknown reasons.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I3bdbad9748dc3d94d6d8914156604eab7ad877a0
"}]
commit_message:
Add '*.pyc' clean up for unit_tests

After updating code from actual branch we still use old *.pyc files.
It can give an unexpected result, for instance, a lot of tests are
broken due to unknown reasons.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I3bdbad9748dc3d94d6d8914156604eab7ad877a0

commit_message:
Removed nonexistent option from quickstart snippet

Neither `ironic-api` nor `ironic-conductor` tools accept
the `-v` option. Although the developer's quickstart guide
has it in the example what makes cut&paste failing.

This quick fix removes the offending option from the doc.

Change-Id: I31e3657f12f7a9cf64697b362cc168333752184c

commit_message:
Adjust stringified dates to the local timezone

Fetch local timezone from session variable 'django_timezone'. This
setting can be either set in Horizon manually or it defaults to the
value of setting TIME_ZONE (with 'UTC' value as a default).

Change-Id: I6c0bbf7b0e0763bd238ab9fa9c4c75e3fdf02fbd

commit_message:
Creates warning for key not found on delete

When deleting the key for barbican currently an exception is being
raised in the case where the key does not exist. This is not required
and can simply be handled with a warning.

Change-Id: I0324d211dd407ce141de95a1e834b787ff958b93
Fixes-bug: #1631305

commit_message:
Fix KeyError for HORIZON_CONFIG['plugins'] in plugin UT

HORIZON_CONFIG['plugins'] does not always exist.
It breaks unit tests of some horizon plugins like designate-dashboard.

Change-Id: I23aae10a7e63494c1c9f656b47becd2f067c9058
Closes-Bug: #1702889

subject: use service type constants from neutron_lib plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-27 21:08:50.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/plugin.py'], 'message': "use service type constants from neutron_lib plugins

The well known service type constants are in
neutron_lib.plugins.constants, but for legacy reasons a few still exist
and are referenced from neutron_lib.constants [1] that we'd like to
remove.

This patch switches references over to neutron_lib's plugin constants.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/constants.py#L353

Change-Id: Ieb3c5890dfba91eff6227c481cd960db3c9da6d4
"}]
commit_message:
use service type constants from neutron_lib plugins

The well known service type constants are in
neutron_lib.plugins.constants, but for legacy reasons a few still exist
and are referenced from neutron_lib.constants [1] that we'd like to
remove.

This patch switches references over to neutron_lib's plugin constants.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/constants.py#L353

Change-Id: Ieb3c5890dfba91eff6227c481cd960db3c9da6d4

[{'number': 25, 'created': '2017-07-06 01:48:46.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/db/base.py', 'glance/api/v2/images.py'], 'message': "Add 'protected' filter to image-list call

Implements v2 API image-list filtering on the 'protected' property
following the spec:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/glance-specs/tree/specs/pike
/approved/glance/add-protected-filter.rst
The 'protected' query string parameter accepts one of 'true', 'false'.
Any other value raises a 400 with an appropriate message.
See the discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/451560/
for why this implementation strategy was chosen.

Change-Id: Ie90d952edddd3f69b3f489f056ff506e63f96376

"}]
commit_message:
Add 'protected' filter to image-list call

Implements v2 API image-list filtering on the 'protected' property
following the spec:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/glance-specs/tree/specs/pike
/approved/glance/add-protected-filter.rst
The 'protected' query string parameter accepts one of 'true', 'false'.
Any other value raises a 400 with an appropriate message.
See the discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/451560/
for why this implementation strategy was chosen.

Change-Id: Ie90d952edddd3f69b3f489f056ff506e63f96376
Closes-Bug: #1674246

commit_message:
Unity: unexpected data in share from snapshot

The share created from snapshot had inconsistent data with the snapshot,
but consistent with the original share. Because the snapshot was
created on wrong `storage resource`.

Change-Id: Ia135c93bd9eedaba549426ea9233a90767de5d46
Closes-bug: 1701458

commit_message:
Include init_systemd taskfile once

Instead of providing vars to and including the keystone_init_systemd for
each keystone uwsgi program, loop over those program names within the
tasks.

This also prevents the /etc/tmpfiles.d/keystone.conf file from being
overwritten twice on every run.

Backport note:
This has been adapted to include the changes required
for upstart.

Change-Id: I00dc80db7f6672fb26af0ec2301b3a4ea451844d
(cherry picked from commit 1b8a085b79af78b3806744eae686086c2050e00c)

subject: Neutron API workers fix
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-07 11:30:10.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/neutron-api.yaml'], 'message': "Neutron API workers fix

THT was setting the api and rpc workers to '' by default. This is
causing Neutron to spawn 1:1, workers to core count. This commit fixes
the problem of neutorn spawning 1:1, with using the conditional that
is in Pike to ignore the unset value.

Change-Id: I741b01bf574662bd446b0823563928153b69f04b
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron API workers fix

THT was setting the api and rpc workers to '' by default. This is
causing Neutron to spawn 1:1, workers to core count. This commit fixes
the problem of neutorn spawning 1:1, with using the conditional that
is in Pike to ignore the unset value.

Change-Id: I741b01bf574662bd446b0823563928153b69f04b

commit_message:
Add deploy_server_id and bootstrap_node_id to inventory

These variables match those provided by the heat-config hook when running
the ansible deploy steps in t-h-t, so adding them to the inventory will
enable also running the same tasks outside of heat in future, which may be
useful for manual upgrades and developer testing.

Change-Id: I433c9c1fad71d8713a74899268f19062ab368290
Depends-On: I2fc48eec77210805c0139fa4abcbf4dd721e7c37

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 14:54:23.000000000', 'files': ['vars/suse-42.yml'], 'message': "vars: suse-42: Drop libgcc_s1 dependency

openSUSE provides multiple versions of gcc (and libgcc) and the
correct variant of libgcc is always pulled in when we install
'gcc'. As such, drop the explicit libgcc_s1 dependency and let

Change-Id: If37d71c55f775a4996b97bf5806e274ce2f39c46
"}]
commit_message:
vars: suse-42: Drop libgcc_s1 dependency

openSUSE provides multiple versions of gcc (and libgcc) and the
correct variant of libgcc is always pulled in when we install
'gcc'. As such, drop the explicit libgcc_s1 dependency and let
zypper pull the correct version for us.

Change-Id: If37d71c55f775a4996b97bf5806e274ce2f39c46

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-19 07:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_scheduler_hints.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/scheduler_hints.py'], 'message': 'Limits the scheduler_hints additionalProperties to string and list

If you pass scheduler_hint's additional properties value as 'None',
as shown below, then create server API returns 500 error.

  '{"os:scheduler_hints": {"key": null}'

The RequestSpecs expects scheduler hints to be either of type string
or list(array). To fix this issue, restricted additional properties
to be string or list in schema, for other values it will return 400
error to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1682811
Change-Id: I1e7410e42562e135ac45f9cb3f002580b674d508
'}]
commit_message:
Limits the scheduler_hints additionalProperties to string and list

If you pass scheduler_hint's additional properties value as 'None',
as shown below, then create server API returns 500 error.

  '{"os:scheduler_hints": {"key": null}'

The RequestSpecs expects scheduler hints to be either of type string
or list(array). To fix this issue, restricted additional properties
to be string or list in schema, for other values it will return 400
error to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1682811
Change-Id: I1e7410e42562e135ac45f9cb3f002580b674d508

commit_message:
vars: suse-42: Drop libgcc_s1 dependency

openSUSE provides multiple versions of gcc (and libgcc) and the
correct variant of libgcc is always pulled in when we install
'gcc'. As such, drop the explicit libgcc_s1 dependency and let
zypper pull the correct version for us.

Change-Id: Iafb3a6d6588f9667fc9cc464f24f40ef82f316da

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 2011, 'name': 'Ian Main', 'email': 'imain@redhat.com', 'username': 'imain'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-20 15:51:05.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml'], 'message': "Use HAproxy config files copied by Kolla bootstrap

Make the HAProxy process read the configuration file that is
copied by Kolla bootstrap, rather than directly bind-mounting
the host config-data/haproxy/etc into /etc

With this change we aim at preventing keeping open files on
the host, so that updates to /var/lib/config-data won't break.

For this change to take effect, the haproxy_bundle puppet profile
must be changed as well in puppet-tripleo

Partial-Bug: #1698323

Change-Id: Ib14396d8e479dad84eb76300ae3c7e227f23c226
"}]
commit_message:
Use HAproxy config files copied by Kolla bootstrap

Make the HAProxy process read the configuration file that is
copied by Kolla bootstrap, rather than directly bind-mounting
the host config-data/haproxy/etc into /etc

With this change we aim at preventing keeping open files on
the host, so that updates to /var/lib/config-data won't break.

For this change to take effect, the haproxy_bundle puppet profile
must be changed as well in puppet-tripleo

Partial-Bug: #1698323

Change-Id: Ib14396d8e479dad84eb76300ae3c7e227f23c226

subject: Cast the resulting intersect set into a list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 17:27:33.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/neutron_db_setup.yml', 'handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'Cast the resulting intersect set into a list

When using Ansible with python3, the result of
the intersect filter is a set, not a list. This
causes a failure when trying to access item 0
in the list.

In this patch we cast the set to a list before
accessing item 0. This will work for both
python2 and python3.

Change-Id: I9b2a01882bfd5f02e0e0b85e1d57fab0fa88d0e9
'}]
commit_message:
Cast the resulting intersect set into a list

When using Ansible with python3, the result of
the intersect filter is a set, not a list. This
causes a failure when trying to access item 0
in the list.

In this patch we cast the set to a list before
accessing item 0. This will work for both
python2 and python3.

Change-Id: I9b2a01882bfd5f02e0e0b85e1d57fab0fa88d0e9

commit_message:
Add 'networks' quota in quota sample files

'networks' quota can be available based on config value.
api-ref should show that for quota-set APIs and also sample files
so that it can be tested somewhere.

Also adding it to quota class APIs sample files also.
Closes-Bug: #1702201

Change-Id: I84d562a8ca10826dea4675d74669b5de64ff0ed0

commit_message:
mitaka-eol: Remove unused charm trusty jobs

charm repos do not have stable/mitaka branches - and neither have a
special branch role to run trusty jobs on other branches. Thus remove
all trusty jobs for them, they are completely unused.

commit_message:
Add os-service-types project

The API-WG recently defined the publication of data about the official
service types and their historical aliases. os-service-types is a
library to consume and encapsulate that data properly for anyone using
python.

Needed-By: I7621760d16c282c8671580e4f7be17ee1699e511
Change-Id: If63f602e1e8a4ce3867b99adef5a07c29aa44630

As described here:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/resource/core.py#L841
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/conf/identity.py#L21

* default project domain name MUST be named 'Default'
* default project domain id MUST be named 'default'
* default project user name MUST be named 'Default'
* default project user id MUST be named 'default'

Change-Id: I610a0416647fdea31bb04889364da5395d8c8d74
"}]
commit_message:
Standardize Keystone domain variables

As described here:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/resource/core.py#L841
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/conf/identity.py#L21

* default project domain name MUST be named 'Default'
* default project domain id MUST be named 'default'
* default project user name MUST be named 'Default'
* default project user id MUST be named 'default'

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2017-07-03 14:05:41.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/utils/openstack/keystone.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings', 'mistral/services/security.py'], 'message': 'Use recommended function to setup auth middleware in devstack

Currently Mistral has own configuration for keystone
auth middleware, many parameters of which are deprecated [1].
It's not desired behavior and it is suggested to use recommended
devstack configuration function to prevent possible errors if
something is changed in keystone deployment in the future.

This patch fixes this situation and implements official
"configure_auth_token_middleware" function support.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/712438ebf9ee30d553f6b515e38b1c91a9ae498e/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_auth.py#L29-L35

Change-Id: I884777826d6ed40d58f75ec5dfba93a876752dfe
Closes-bug: #1697662
'}]
commit_message:
Use recommended function to setup auth middleware in devstack

Currently Mistral has own configuration for keystone
auth middleware, many parameters of which are deprecated [1].
It's not desired behavior and it is suggested to use recommended
devstack configuration function to prevent possible errors if
something is changed in keystone deployment in the future.

This patch fixes this situation and implements official
"configure_auth_token_middleware" function support.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/712438ebf9ee30d553f6b515e38b1c91a9ae498e/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_auth.py#L29-L35

Change-Id: I884777826d6ed40d58f75ec5dfba93a876752dfe
Closes-bug: #1697662

subject: Skip integration tests/non-doc jobs for certain patrole changes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-07-05 15:20:22.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Skip integration tests/non-doc jobs for certain patrole changes

Two types of skips are introduced:
  - All non-doc jobs should be skipped for doc-only Patrole changes
  - All integration jobs should be skipped for unit test-only
    Patrole changes

Simple changes to unit tests and docs should not trigger expensive
RBAC tests -- which are currently a battery of Tempest API tests
across 5 different jobs.

Change-Id: Id7ecdc1645636719cab211bdd8e413edf0fbcd2b
'}]
commit_message:
Skip integration tests/non-doc jobs for certain patrole changes

Two types of skips are introduced:
  - All non-doc jobs should be skipped for doc-only Patrole changes
  - All integration jobs should be skipped for unit test-only
    Patrole changes

Simple changes to unit tests and docs should not trigger expensive
RBAC tests -- which are currently a battery of Tempest API tests
across 5 different jobs.

Change-Id: Id7ecdc1645636719cab211bdd8e413edf0fbcd2b

subject: Switch from run_once back to inventory scoping
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-04 14:53:12.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/neutron_db_setup.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/neutron_service_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Switch from run_once back to inventory scoping

As it turns out, run_once executes a task
once per batch when executed from a serialised
playbook instead of once per set of play hosts
as previously thought.

In this patch we implement a combination of
dynamic inclusion, inventory scoping and
play host scoping to achieve the required
goal of only running it once, even when the
playbook is executed using limits.

Depends-On: I548971e2de92280fe2cc4ff0a6a926497733fa7d
Change-Id: Icde03cd2610f52859fd8d2d7540f442a36e51695
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from run_once back to inventory scoping

As it turns out, run_once executes a task
once per batch when executed from a serialised
playbook instead of once per set of play hosts
as previously thought.

In this patch we implement a combination of
dynamic inclusion, inventory scoping and
play host scoping to achieve the required
goal of only running it once, even when the
playbook is executed using limits.

Depends-On: I548971e2de92280fe2cc4ff0a6a926497733fa7d
Change-Id: Icde03cd2610f52859fd8d2d7540f442a36e51695

commit_message:
Improve inventory scoping for limited play execution

When executing the playbook with limits set, the scoping
currently does not work quite as well as one would hope.

This tightens it a bit more to ensure that it operates
as expected.

Change-Id: I8ebd42bcdf9676fd580955256498bbd8801f1cbd

subject: tests: host_vars: localhost: Do not disable PrivateDevices
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-07 08:47:07.000000000', 'files': ['tests/host_vars/localhost.yml'], 'message': 'tests: host_vars: localhost: Do not disable PrivateDevices

The tests are making use of the common/test-vars.yml file which uses
the following condition to determine if PrivateDevices need to be
disabled or not

{{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }}"

However, 'properties' is not defined in that role leading to the
following problem

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "AnsibleUndefinedVariable: {{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }}: 'properties' is undefined"}

We can safely define this variable for the tests in order to override
the one from the common yaml file.

Change-Id: Iedaf10b4a194a8f9a9f35acd7e08e4bf7209dd5c
'}]
commit_message:
tests: host_vars: localhost: Do not disable PrivateDevices

The tests are making use of the common/test-vars.yml file which uses
the following condition to determine if PrivateDevices need to be
disabled or not

{{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }}"

However, 'properties' is not defined in that role leading to the
following problem

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "AnsibleUndefinedVariable: {{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }}: 'properties' is undefined"}

We can safely define this variable for the tests in order to override
the one from the common yaml file.

Change-Id: Iedaf10b4a194a8f9a9f35acd7e08e4bf7209dd5c

subject: add to judge whether resources end up with 'y' when clean up
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-07 01:29:28.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/cleanup/resources.py'], 'message': "add to judge whether resources end up with 'y' when clean up

When clean up some resources in neutron, some resources such as
policy which end up with 'y', it will be add 's' in the end.
Actually it should be 'ies', or the resources will not be deleted.

Change-Id: I161050421b2a0480756a8548192e11ff10718c3b
"}]
commit_message:
add to judge whether resources end up with 'y' when clean up

When clean up some resources in neutron, some resources such as
policy which end up with 'y', it will be add 's' in the end.
Actually it should be 'ies', or the resources will not be deleted.

Change-Id: I161050421b2a0480756a8548192e11ff10718c3b

commit_message:
use the variable holding the service types url instead of an inline value

There is a global variable with the URL for the service types authority
list. Use that instead of the hard-coded value.

Change-Id: I05187afd72b3e18c6308dba257fcc4d41e604d7e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

fix the way the language bindings page renders

description. One of the clients did not have a description value.

revisions:

Without this patch, the play aborts without retries when
fernet_create.stdout.split()[2] doesn't exist.

Closes-Bug: #1700715

commit_message:
Prevent unexpected abort when initializing fernet key authentication

Without this patch, the play aborts without retries when
fernet_create.stdout.split()[2] doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I8f9cd7830051f7b1cbfc607dbfd85a6452e0571a
Closes-Bug: #1700715

commit_message:
Use GroupSnapshotStatus enum field

The GroupSnapshotStatus and GroupSnapshotStatusField have been defined
already, This change just replaces the omissive group snapshot string
status with group snapshot enum field.

commit_message:
misc cleanups

Cosmetic cleanups only:
- API definition: use constants from neutron-lib
- API definition: remove useless EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING use
- BGPVPN driver API: add missing precommit abstract methods
- tests: better indendation of with statements
- tests: better error reporting when developing tests
- s/datas/data

Change-Id: I772b6c9c904423aa0d0e0ab6cdaeca63f5907f07

revisions:

commit_message:
dashboard: fix bug about the create BGPVPN form

We can't display the form to create a new
BGPVPN in panel admin > BGPVPN Interconnections.

Django 1.9 is now used by Horizon. In this release,
url tag from future library is removed. So it's
impossible to use this tag in a jinja template.

Change-Id: Ie4f96019521136ccca29216056a5d94a55b9ae2f
Closes-Bug: 1702287

subject: dashboard: change clean method in create and update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-04 13:54:50.000000000', 'files': ['bgpvpn_dashboard/dashboards/project/bgpvpn/forms.py'], 'message': "dashboard: change clean method in create and update

When a user create or edit a BGP VPN, the attributes
RTs are still sent in the API request even if the
related fields are empty.

This path change this behavior. So, in the form, if the
RTs fields are empty, the attributes aren't sent in
the API request.

Change-Id: I93e68f16aed31ea8ad99579e3cd7cb498bf85e14
"}]
commit_message:
dashboard: change clean method in create and update

When a user create or edit a BGP VPN, the attributes
RTs are still sent in the API request even if the
related fields are empty.

This path change this behavior. So, in the form, if the
RTs fields are empty, the attributes aren't sent in
the API request.

Change-Id: I93e68f16aed31ea8ad99579e3cd7cb498bf85e14

revisions:

in version Pike, and it will be removed in version Queens.

For other details, please check [1] and [2]
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468036/

commit_message:
Replace the usage of 'manager' with 'os_primary'

In tempest, alias 'manager' has been moved to 'os_primary'
in version Pike, and it will be removed in version Queens.
This patch is to replace the usage of 'manager' with 'os_primary'.

For other details, please check [1] and [2]
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468036/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/463484/

Change-Id: I3f6b35ad4b018b84fe6538a408a63aac2f6d5510

commit_message:
Adding docs to octavia project

This patch adds the docs links to the octavia project.
It also clarifies the service to match the service type we were
asked to use[1].

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests/unit tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(x in y) to assertIn(x, y).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail

Change-Id: Ic80d9313a5eedb4f9f604847f99b861419f8f9b0

subject: RemoteFS: prevent creation of encrypted volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 16:17:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py'], 'message': 'RemoteFS: prevent creation of encrypted volumes

Support for volume encryption of FS-based volumes is not
currently implemented in Nova.  Creating encrypted volumes
with these drivers can result in dangerous and undesired
behavior.  Block creation of encrypted volumes for these
drivers until this is supported.

This adds a per-driver switch which can be used to enable
this for individual RemoteFS drivers as they are tested.

Closes-Bug: #1675469

Change-Id: I39d4230106c891e1b480989daaf72bea5a64e4b3
'}]
commit_message:
RemoteFS: prevent creation of encrypted volumes

Support for volume encryption of FS-based volumes is not
currently implemented in Nova.  Creating encrypted volumes
with these drivers can result in dangerous and undesired
behavior.  Block creation of encrypted volumes for these
drivers until this is supported.

This adds a per-driver switch which can be used to enable
this for individual RemoteFS drivers as they are tested.

Closes-Bug: #1675469

Change-Id: I39d4230106c891e1b480989daaf72bea5a64e4b3

commit_message:
OpenVPN deployment with Murano, for OpenStack

OpenVPN allows for a secure & encrypted channel of communication between
end points on different networks. It does so by createing secure
ethernet bridges using virtual tap devices. This feature enables nodes
on private network to onboard nodes on public network to present a
seemless and virtually unified cluster in a hybrid environment.

Implements: blueprint murano-openvpn

Change-Id: I99e76d51d8cd269431db8c90c66f218e871e1ec7
Co-Authored-By: Bhasker Nallapothula <bhaskern@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shanker Iyer <shankeri@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gangadhar Sunkara <gangadhars@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pradip Kumar Rawat <pradipkumarr@vedams.com>

subject: Implement rolling upgrades for keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-07-07 04:31:44.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/keystone_all.yml', 'playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': "Implement rolling upgrades for keystone

The current rolling upgrade implementation
relies on the role to orchestrate the rolling
upgrade. When the role is executed using
playbook serialisation, the db sync contract
is executed before all hosts are upgraded,
potentially resulting in data corruption.

This patch implements the use of playbook
serialisation for the upgrade and fact checking
to determine when it is safe to execute the db
sync contract.

Additionally, tasks which only need to be
executed against a single keystone host
in the invevntory are specifically targeted
rather than being skipped on the other hosts.
This should provide a slight performance
improvement.

Backport note:
- The serial values were all changed to '1' due to
  Ansible 2.1's lack of support for a list value.

Depends-On: I5650f16b9a115bd392012b743788057a94d09226
Change-Id: Iac59e792a642a9e57d6d279a7d4b3d41fe419b38
(cherry picked from commit ecf32e20784d733fa89e1b0a392fd4b565ca4f41)
"}]
commit_message:
Implement rolling upgrades for keystone

The current rolling upgrade implementation
relies on the role to orchestrate the rolling
upgrade. When the role is executed using
playbook serialisation, the db sync contract
is executed before all hosts are upgraded,
potentially resulting in data corruption.

This patch implements the use of playbook
serialisation for the upgrade and fact checking
to determine when it is safe to execute the db
sync contract.

Additionally, tasks which only need to be
executed against a single keystone host
in the invevntory are specifically targeted
rather than being skipped on the other hosts.
This should provide a slight performance
improvement.

Backport note:
- The serial values were all changed to '1' due to
  Ansible 2.1's lack of support for a list value.

Depends-On: I5650f16b9a115bd392012b743788057a94d09226
Change-Id: Iac59e792a642a9e57d6d279a7d4b3d41fe419b38
(cherry picked from commit ecf32e20784d733fa89e1b0a392fd4b565ca4f41)

subject: Fixes wrong path for Roboto in the filesystem
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 09:28:47.000000000', 'files': ['xstatic/pkg/roboto_fontface/data/css/mixins.scss'], 'message': 'Fixes wrong path for Roboto in the filesystem

Fonts are available under fonts/roboto/Roboto-*, whereas
SCSS references to them always as Roboto. Filesystem is
case-sensitive, therefore this patch makes SCSS use the
correct path to the file by lowercasing the variable used.

Change-Id: Ic90e608938f80199c54a8d8ba0d40345d3a1f731
Closes-bug: #1671004
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes wrong path for Roboto in the filesystem

Fonts are available under fonts/roboto/Roboto-*, whereas
SCSS references to them always as Roboto. Filesystem is
case-sensitive, therefore this patch makes SCSS use the
correct path to the file by lowercasing the variable used.

Change-Id: Ic90e608938f80199c54a8d8ba0d40345d3a1f731
Closes-bug: #1671004

commit_message:
Fix arguments for OS::Mistral::CronTrigger create

In python-mistralclient, the `workflow_name` argument was renamed to
`workflow_identifier` in version 2.0.0, breaking this resource type. Ensure
that this works with all client versions by passing the first two arguments
as positional rather than keyword args.

Change-Id: Ibbed3af468bbc0d68995495095b6cd340c1ea427
Closes-Bug: #1557575
(cherry picked from commit f682e7afed80ea0bcd19f42644a64a0b750f3eac)

commit_message:
Replace voluptuous with JSONSchema to validate change_node_power_state

Now in watcher,both JSONSchema and voluptuous are used to validate
JSON payloads. We want to remove voluptuous and Use
JSONSchema as our only JSON validation tool to keep consistence
and also to make it easier to expose the validation schema
through our API in future work.

In this patch, we replace voluptuous with JSONSchema to validate
the change_node_power_state action in watcher applier.

Partially Implements: blueprint jsonschema-validation

Change-Id: If9ffe5e0b107e0da5673247e4d5ec9917790827f

commit_message:
Update security compliance documentation

The security compliance settings in the admin guide
referenced configuration options that no longer work.
The functionality to exclude users from password expiry
or password changing was moved to per user resource options.

This change also consolidates the duplicate documentation
between the advanced topics in the operator guide into the
admin-guide.

Closes-Bug: #1701389
Change-Id: I36be658f0a1efb25c55b24596bf67639c69c89d9

commit_message:
Add base tempest class for heat

We have start to adopt tempest plugin and allow our test on top of
it. This patch add base class for heat tempest test that will use
authentication and clients from tempest base class. We will
converge our tempest test base on these base client and client
manager in future.
Partially-Implements: blueprint heat-tempest-converge

subject: Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 2101, 'name': 'Brent Roskos', 'email': 'broskos@redhat.com', 'username': 'broskos'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-06 14:32:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': 'Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._delete_floatingip still uses
utils.is_extension_supported to determine if DNS-specific methods should
be run rather than the self._is_dns_integration_supported method used
by _create and _update.

This causes issues with L3 service plugins like Cisco ACI where the core
plugin is ML2 but the L3 plugin does not implement the DNS methods.
When such a plugin sets _dns_integration to False, _create and _update
do not call the DNS-specific plugin methods, but _delete_floatingip does
 which leads to an exception being raised.

This patch changes _delete_floatingip to use the same method for
determining DNS support as _create_floatingip and _update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ieb2db6cb96c5d6aae166aa7f0d2d481b2a3690f9
Closes-Bug: #1702693
'}]
commit_message:
Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._delete_floatingip still uses
utils.is_extension_supported to determine if DNS-specific methods should
be run rather than the self._is_dns_integration_supported method used
by _create and _update.

This causes issues with L3 service plugins like Cisco ACI where the core
plugin is ML2 but the L3 plugin does not implement the DNS methods.
When such a plugin sets _dns_integration to False, _create and _update
do not call the DNS-specific plugin methods, but _delete_floatingip does
 which leads to an exception being raised.

This patch changes _delete_floatingip to use the same method for
determining DNS support as _create_floatingip and _update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ieb2db6cb96c5d6aae166aa7f0d2d481b2a3690f9
Closes-Bug: #1702693

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-03 17:28:59.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/test_hooks.py', 'ironic/tests/common/test_context.py', 'ironic/common/service.py', 'ironic/common/context.py'], 'message': "Enforce clarity by using keyword-only arguments

For the call to create a RequestContext object, ensure that the caller
is using keyword arguments. The benefit of this is that there is no
confusion about what arguments are being used.

Previously callers could make a call like:
    ctx = RequestContext(None, 'user', None, 'example.com')

This change will require the callers to specify each argument using a
keyword.

Update call to oslo_context.context.RequestContext that was not using
keywords.

Added unit tests for change. Added autospec=True to mocks of
RequestContext.

Change-Id: Iba835d5f97e60acf69a3fa2002191687778ce971
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce clarity by using keyword-only arguments

For the call to create a RequestContext object, ensure that the caller
is using keyword arguments. The benefit of this is that there is no
confusion about what arguments are being used.

Previously callers could make a call like:
    ctx = RequestContext(None, 'user', None, 'example.com')

This change will require the callers to specify each argument using a
keyword.

Update call to oslo_context.context.RequestContext that was not using
keywords.

Added unit tests for change. Added autospec=True to mocks of
RequestContext.

Change-Id: Iba835d5f97e60acf69a3fa2002191687778ce971

commit_message:
Gear documentation towards a wider audience

Our documentation previously had a statement saying it was primarily
geared towards contributing developers. This commit removes that
statement and replaces it with a more general one. Subsequent patches
are going to be migrating a bunch of useful information for
contributors, developers, and operators alike.

Change-Id: I8cea91b755f53265c21ec72b01939a7c646d3756

subject: Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-29 03:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['congress/dse2/dse_node.py'], 'message': "Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods
since 5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

FutureWarning: The access_policy argument is changing its default
value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'>
in version '?', please update the code to explicitly set None as the
value: access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes
private methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy
or ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: Ie17832d64075080c17c09df675b216dbe8af16e6
"}]
commit_message:
Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods
since 5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

FutureWarning: The access_policy argument is changing its default
value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'>
in version '?', please update the code to explicitly set None as the
value: access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes
private methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy
or ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: Ie17832d64075080c17c09df675b216dbe8af16e6

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv
and remove python 3.4.

Change-Id: Id5363a59d4dff28d47a79feb2b40d09d7e27cac4

commit_message:
Fix comment for API binary name in WSGIService

The compute API binary service name is a constant source of
confusion, sometimes called nova-api or nova-os_compute, which are
both wrong, since it's actually nova-osapi_compute. It comes from
nova.cmd.api.

Change-Id: I50befc34730296d3908b6dd25536394608bae0ec

commit_message:
fix readme.rst to reflect correct environment variable

The readme.rst incorrectly refers to the environment variable
DIB_APT_KEYS which should be DIB_ADD_APT_KEYS. See [1] for usage in
code.

This is a minor correction to the readme only, no runnable code is
modified.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/diskimage_builder/elements/dpkg/extra-data.d/01-copy-apt-keys#n23

Change-Id: I04129cef9f40ec75a206c126bfd40ee61e4e6a2b

commit_message:
[3/3]Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be
negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

The patch list:
    1. api
    2. image
    3. network
    4. object
    5. volume
    6. tests

Partial-Implements: blueprint replace-iteritems-with-items

Change-Id: I8ac4f96d606a4530209de914542e035c3bd970c0

- Installation settings in devstack:
[[post-config|$NEUTRON_CONF]]

service_plugins=neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin
router_distributed=True

Change-Id: I47b41d99802b4f1adbcbd65d7011d780febd3987
'}]
commit_message:
[POC] Introduction of OpenFlow implementation of DVR.

- Installation settings in devstack:
[[post-config|$NEUTRON_CONF]]
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins=neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin
router_distributed=True
[[post-config|/$Q_L3_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
agent_mode=dvr_bridge
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
[[post-config|/$Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
force_metadata=True
enable_isolated_metadata=True
[[post-config|/$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE]]
[ml2]
types_drivers = vxlan,flat
tenant_network_types = vxlan
extension_drivers = port_security,qos
mechanism_drivers = openvswitch,l2population
[ml2_type_flat]
flat_networks = public
[agent]
l2_population=True
tunnel_types=vxlan
enable_distributed_routing=True
extensions=qos
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
of_interface=ovs-ofctl
local_ip=$HOST_IP

- East/West enabled on IPV4
- North/South enabled on IPV4

Change-Id: I47b41d99802b4f1adbcbd65d7011d780febd3987

commit_message:
Use subqueryload in l2pop DB for binding ports

This adjusts the l2pop DB queries that leverage the port relationship
on the PortBinding and DistributedPortBinding models to ensure that the
port gets loaded from the DB as part of the initial query.

Without this the number of DB queries will increase with the number
of ports since the port wasn't being loaded until the 'port' attribute
was referenced on its corresponding binding object.

Closes-Bug: #1701288
Change-Id: I7c3b08d525b2c90100c9fe4efaee973cf3a076f3
(cherry picked from commit 5be1ace5462994b492b811e20d8a90caac0fcffd)

This adjusts the l2pop DB queries that leverage the port relationship
on the PortBinding and DistributedPortBinding models to ensure that the
port gets loaded from the DB as part of the initial query.

Without this the number of DB queries will increase with the number
of ports since the port wasn't being loaded until the 'port' attribute
was referenced on its corresponding binding object.

Closes-Bug: #1701288
Change-Id: I7c3b08d525b2c90100c9fe4efaee973cf3a076f3
(cherry picked from commit 5be1ace5462994b492b811e20d8a90caac0fcffd)

commit_message:
Use subqueryload in l2pop DB for binding ports

This adjusts the l2pop DB queries that leverage the port relationship
on the PortBinding and DistributedPortBinding models to ensure that the
port gets loaded from the DB as part of the initial query.

Without this the number of DB queries will increase with the number
of ports since the port wasn't being loaded until the 'port' attribute
was referenced on its corresponding binding object.

Closes-Bug: #1701288
Change-Id: I7c3b08d525b2c90100c9fe4efaee973cf3a076f3
(cherry picked from commit 5be1ace5462994b492b811e20d8a90caac0fcffd)

commit_message:
change fernet-key repository permissions to 750

Keystone validates fernet-key repository directory is not readable
from others.  If it's readable, keystone logs the following warning
message.
WARNING keystone.common.fernet_utils [-] key_repository is world readable: /etc/keystone/fernet-keys/
This make change the permissions when the container starting.

Change-Id: Id48c5042817e2530aace1f16915c36c60c544c06
Closes-bug:  #1668514

subject: Fix eventlet monkey patching
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2017-07-05 16:58:57.000000000', 'files': ['blazar/cmd/manager.py', 'blazar/cmd/api.py', 'blazar/api/v1/app.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/scenario/test_reservation_concurrency.py'], 'message': "Fix eventlet monkey patching

Eventlet monkey patching needs to be done as early as possible,
otherwise previous library imports are not patched correctly. This fixes
issues with concurrent requests receiving a 500 Internal Server Error
with a traceback including the following message:

    AttributeError: 'function' object has no attribute 'get'

This commit also adds a new Tempest scenario to test for this issue by
running concurrent requests against the Blazar service.

Change-Id: I9be2b6787a151d54ca9cce5c91fa9e11e727ce0b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix eventlet monkey patching

Eventlet monkey patching needs to be done as early as possible,
otherwise previous library imports are not patched correctly. This fixes
issues with concurrent requests receiving a 500 Internal Server Error
with a traceback including the following message:

    AttributeError: 'function' object has no attribute 'get'

This commit also adds a new Tempest scenario to test for this issue by
running concurrent requests against the Blazar service.

Change-Id: I9be2b6787a151d54ca9cce5c91fa9e11e727ce0b

commit_message:
Run hooks for DisplayCommandBase

Command base class has provisions to run hooks for a command in
its run() method. We need to do the same for the
DisplayCommandBase class since it does not call super().run()

commit_message:
placement: filter usage records by resource provider id

The usage records are used to build the provider summary in the
AllocationCandidates.get_by_filters. Due to miss a filter on the
resource provider id, the extra resource provider summary returned.

Change-Id: Idc27e3ab3d4e1d2c6ade2f719572cbc2f5eee133
Closes-Bug: #1702275

commit_message:
Rename method 'delete' to 'delete_backup' in backup drivers

Once we'll get generic-backup-implementation blueprint done it will be
confusion to have 'delete' method in volume drivers. After this change
we'll have two methods: 'delete_volume' and 'delete_backup' which should
be clear for maintainers.

This patch doesn't change any public API so it should be clear for
operators and users.

Change-Id: I7f975066c1c848fec7e930a9d71b7225f3250acc
Related-blueprint: generic-backup-implementation

commit_message:
Implement rolling upgrades for glance

Using the pattern established in [1], install glance services in a way
that allows for minimal interruptions during upgrades. Upgrades are
serialized such that only one glance host is unavailable at a time.

[1] Change I0bdb51ce0d8b3b9a145d29ef6808e1fe595924e2

Backport note:
- The serial values were all changed to '1' due to
  Ansible 2.1's lack of support for a list value.

Depends-On: I4a4d8f23f05a16d25878340ede019be7ccdb7196
Change-Id: I1c70563c7b5bb3e5666821e9288d723b26d9903e
(cherry picked from commit 27298a7f38cc40547744c6b60f2c331761f6c0f2)

commit_message:
Implement rolling upgrades for glance

Using the pattern established in [1], install glance services in a way
that allows for minimal interruptions during upgrades. Upgrades are
serialized such that only one glance host is unavailable at a time.

[1] Change I0bdb51ce0d8b3b9a145d29ef6808e1fe595924e2

Depends-On: I4a4d8f23f05a16d25878340ede019be7ccdb7196

subject: Implement rolling upgrades for neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-07-05 20:40:37.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/common-playbooks/neutron.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron-rolling-upgrades-5269b62ea216df5e.yaml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'Implement rolling upgrades for neutron

Based on [1], this patch implements changes to the playbook
which executes the neutron deployment in a play per host
group, serialised to ensure that:

1. The services are changed in the right order.
2. The API services remain available at all times during
   an upgrade (except when doing a db contract).
3. If services are sharing a host/container then the
   role execution will not execute twice on the same
   host.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/upgrade.html

Depends-On: I368b51ef37763f4163ead591d6743c4d56962ef9
Depends-On: I7dfef45e1ed8a8dfa464f1b3d20c90ae3348ce2e
Change-Id: Ib9067042066e9b5b2cd7418ea7f7f96225302852
(cherry picked from commit 14793d701dcbcdb66f60bdea120c29762dbdc61d)
'}]
commit_message:
Implement rolling upgrades for neutron

Based on [1], this patch implements changes to the playbook
which executes the neutron deployment in a play per host
group, serialised to ensure that:

1. The services are changed in the right order.
2. The API services remain available at all times during
   an upgrade (except when doing a db contract).
3. If services are sharing a host/container then the
   role execution will not execute twice on the same
   host.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/upgrade.html

Depends-On: I368b51ef37763f4163ead591d6743c4d56962ef9
Depends-On: I7dfef45e1ed8a8dfa464f1b3d20c90ae3348ce2e
Change-Id: Ib9067042066e9b5b2cd7418ea7f7f96225302852
(cherry picked from commit 14793d701dcbcdb66f60bdea120c29762dbdc61d)

In particular, mark the container as 'Error' state if the container
is not founded in docker daemon. This kind of handling should be

Change-Id: I2939c886d63b42f8945540a4fd7d0ee2679157b3
"}]
commit_message:
Handle docker error consistently

In particular, mark the container as 'Error' state if the container
is not founded in docker daemon. This kind of handling should be
consistent across all APIs. This commit introduce a decorator for
such exception handling.

Change-Id: I2939c886d63b42f8945540a4fd7d0ee2679157b3

subject: Perform an atomic policy file change
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-26 10:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_init_common.yml', 'tasks/nova_init_systemd.yml', 'templates/nova-systemd-tmpfiles.j2', 'templates/nova-upstart-init.j2', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_post_install.yml', 'templates/nova-systemd-init.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_init_upstart.yml'], 'message': 'Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Backport note:
Re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/459323

Change-Id: Icba9df7be6012576eca0afb040a6953809cc9a5f
'}]
commit_message:
Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Backport note:
Re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/459323

Change-Id: Icba9df7be6012576eca0afb040a6953809cc9a5f

subject: Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 06:40:20.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3. The html_last_updated_fmt
option is interpreted as a byte string in python3, causing
Sphinx build to break. This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I707f9266ec06549d3c4dbd44111b43d8616a6355
'}]
commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3. The html_last_updated_fmt
option is interpreted as a byte string in python3, causing
Sphinx build to break. This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I707f9266ec06549d3c4dbd44111b43d8616a6355

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-03 21:25:55.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tripleo_common/image/image_uploader.py'], 'message': "Upgrade from docker-py to docker

The pypi package 'docker-py' [1] has been renamed to 'docker' [2].
It is better to move to the new 'docker' package because the old
package will be deprecated and all the new features will go into
the new package only.

Package 'docker' has been added to requirements [3]. The old
package 'docker-py' is still allowed to be in the global requirements
during the transition period but it should be removed after all or
most of the projects finsih the migration.

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/docker-py
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/docker
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423715/

Change-Id: Id440e7362a65ddd56cfb77f3a8b502750c283a21
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrade from docker-py to docker

The pypi package 'docker-py' [1] has been renamed to 'docker' [2].
It is better to move to the new 'docker' package because the old
package will be deprecated and all the new features will go into
the new package only.

Package 'docker' has been added to requirements [3]. The old
package 'docker-py' is still allowed to be in the global requirements
during the transition period but it should be removed after all or
most of the projects finsih the migration.

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/docker-py
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/docker
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423715/

Change-Id: Id440e7362a65ddd56cfb77f3a8b502750c283a21

subject: Simplify and optimise cinder tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-06 09:12:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/cinder_db_setup.yml', 'tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_install.yml', 'tasks/cinder_cleanup_old_facts.yml'], 'message': 'Simplify and optimise cinder tasks

The upgrade fact set was more complex than it
needed to be, and we can use better inventory
scoping combined with ansible_play_hosts in
order to make the execution more friendly to
limited execution.

We also cater for setting facts even if the
new role is being used without the venv
changing.

Backport note:
ansible_play_hosts in Ansible 2.1.1 provides
the hosts for the play serial batch and not
the hosts for the play as a whole. It is
therefore not suitable, so we leave the
task scoping as it was.

Depends-On: I90d09fe354d87b099024019ceeb2b7e129ef35d0
Change-Id: I97ace7c89dc7015e2e740516695d4e61971cf020
(cherry picked from commit 8f1781a65593e568a0e009487b32d0ae9505e317)
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify and optimise cinder tasks

The upgrade fact set was more complex than it
needed to be, and we can use better inventory
scoping combined with ansible_play_hosts in
order to make the execution more friendly to
limited execution.

We also cater for setting facts even if the
new role is being used without the venv
changing.

Backport note:
ansible_play_hosts in Ansible 2.1.1 provides
the hosts for the play serial batch and not
the hosts for the play as a whole. It is
therefore not suitable, so we leave the
task scoping as it was.

Depends-On: I90d09fe354d87b099024019ceeb2b7e129ef35d0
Change-Id: I97ace7c89dc7015e2e740516695d4e61971cf020
(cherry picked from commit 8f1781a65593e568a0e009487b32d0ae9505e317)

In OpenStack CI, the EPEL repository is installed but disabled. As
such we need to make sure that we enable it before we run our tests
since it's required by some packages.

commit_message:
run_tests_common.sh: Ensure EPEL is enabled

In OpenStack CI, the EPEL repository is installed but disabled. As
such we need to make sure that we enable it before we run our tests
since it's required by some packages.

Link: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/478095/
Change-Id: I87bc98a76470119edccf4169e5cb78d05c2cdb49

revisions:

implementing a change in the software, resulting

Change-Id: I1e783c5a791ab66fbb693f672d87cbf092cf8112

commit_message:
Hedge upgrade process against no software change

Some deployers make use of the new role without
implementing a change in the software, resulting
in the correct local facts not being deployed.

To hedge against this, we add some more conditionals
to ensure that the facts are deployed.

Change-Id: I1e783c5a791ab66fbb693f672d87cbf092cf8112
(cherry picked from commit 4268636066b18b39668022f859d0490b00a8d7a2)

subject: deploy failed when didn't defined node_config_directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 08:07:06.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/common/tasks/config.yml'], 'message': 'deploy failed when didn't defined node_config_directory

I was failed to deploy without defining node_config_directory.
If node_config_directory was not defined,
kolla use "/etc/kolla" as a default directory.
however most systems set the /etc to root privilege.

So we need to run create directory task as a root at first,
and change owner of directory with ansible_user.

Change-Id: I61922100c4607e75fc3eb3859e6f4d575cfa04f8
Closes-Bug: #1702630
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>
'}]
commit_message:
deploy failed when didn't defined node_config_directory

I was failed to deploy without defining node_config_directory.
If node_config_directory was not defined,
kolla use "/etc/kolla" as a default directory.
however most systems set the /etc to root privilege.

So we need to run create directory task as a root at first,
and change owner of directory with ansible_user.

Change-Id: I61922100c4607e75fc3eb3859e6f4d575cfa04f8
Closes-Bug: #1702630
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>

commit_message:
Hedge upgrade process against no software change

Some deployers make use of the new role without
implementing a change in the software, resulting
in the correct local facts not being deployed.

To hedge against this, we add some more conditionals
to ensure that the facts are deployed.

Change-Id: I1e783c5a791ab66fbb693f672d87cbf092cf8112
(cherry picked from commit 4268636066b18b39668022f859d0490b00a8d7a2)

commit_message:
Fixing timing_counter based swift graphs

The non_negative_derivative function applied to the timing_counter
based graphs is replaced by the mean function, since these
timing_counter are not exactly behaving like traditional counters.

Change-Id: I5e2e5cdd2d04f469853f59f96da68839830bb359
